li.a: Point Pleasant Borough High School Athletic Programs

br.div: The Point Pleasant Borough School District administration continues to carefully monitor the evolving situation surrounding the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). We are following guidance that has been provided by the New Jersey Department of Education who is in contact with the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) and the Ocean County Health Department.

We understand that this is a stressful time for students, and we encourage you to utilize the resources and information on this page to assist with your child's needs during this unprecedented and challenging time. Additionally, all school counselors will be available by email Monday through Friday during the hours of 8:00 am - 2:30 pm. They will provide you with additional information if further assistance is needed.

ul.li: NCTSN - Parent/Caregiver Guide to Helping Families Cope With the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) (PDF)
LSU - Supporting Children and Adolescents Isolated Due to Coronavirus (PDF)
NASP - Talking to Children about COVID-19 (PDF)

strong.a: Child Mind Institute - Talking to Kids About the Coronavirus
Psychology Today - How to Talk to Your Anxious Child About the Coronavirus

a.strong: Effective School Solutions - Supporting Student Stress, Anxiety & Mental Health

ul.li: A Kids Book About COVID-19 (Free eBook)

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

ul.li: Ocean County Library​​​​​​​ is providing support to families and educators during their remote learning experience. Take advantage of digital materials, educational resources and sign up for a temporary digital library card!
NJ Department of Children and Families - Child Care Information​​​​​​​

Parents and guardians in need of child care can contact the Child Care Resource and Referral Agency in their county. CCR&Rs will have the most up to date information on available care options and subsidies.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: For a life-threatening emergency, always dial 911.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: An emergency is considered to be any serious and sudden medical, emotional, or behavioral health situation that, if not given immediate professional attention, could lead to your child being severely harmed or possibly harming someone else.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: If you have an emergency situation involving your child that is life-threatening, seek help immediately by dialing 911.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: If your situation is not immediately life-threatening, contact

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(22, 39, 50); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(22, 39, 50); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: at 1-877-652-7624 and follow the menu prompts provided for an urgent situation. They will ask you a series of questions to determine how they can help. If they find that your child should be evaluated for hospitalization, they will refer you to a local screening center.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The NJ Department of Human Services offers a
p.a: list of crisis/screening centers by county.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

strong.span: Psychiatric Emergency Service System (PESS) at Ocean Medical:

li.span: 1-800-273-8255.The Lifeline provides 24/7 free and confidential support for people during emergencies. The Lifeline also helps specific groups, such as youth, loss survivors, veterans, LGBTQ+, and more, cope with suicidal thoughts.

li.span: 1-855-654-6735. The NJ Hopeline has specialists available 24/7 who offer counseling and support over the phone.

li.span: 2NDFLOOR is a confidential helpline for New Jersey’s youth that helps find solutions to problems they face at home, at school, or at play.

strong.a: Department of Children and Families - Hotlines and Helplines

li.span: The New Jersey Children's System of Care defines an emergency as any serious medical, emotional or behavioral health condition with a sudden onset that, if not dealt with right away, is severe enough that a prudent layperson who possesses an average knowledge of medicine and health could reasonably expect the absence of immediate attention to result in jeopardy to the life or health of the child, youth or young adult, or harm to another person by the child, youth or young adult.
